Package com.stehno.ersatz.cfg

Interface ServerConfig

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServerConfigImpl
    public interface ServerConfig
    Configuration interface for an Ersatz server instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ServerConfig authentication​(groovy.lang.Closure closure)
      Registers authentication configuration as a Groovy Closure.
      ServerConfig authentication​(java.util.function.Consumer<AuthenticationConfig> config)
      Registers authentication configuration as a Consumer<AuthenticationConfig>.
      ServerConfig autoStart​(boolean enabled)
      Used to enable/disable the auto-start feature, which will start the server after any call to either of the expectations configuration methods.
      ServerConfig decoder​(ContentType contentType, java.util.function.BiFunction<byte[],​DecodingContext,​java.lang.Object> decoder)
      Configures the given request content decoder for the specified request content-type.
      ServerConfig decoder​(java.lang.String contentType, java.util.function.BiFunction<byte[],​DecodingContext,​java.lang.Object> decoder)
      Configures the given request content decoder for the specified request content-type.
      default ServerConfig encoder​(ContentType contentType, java.lang.Class objectType, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,​byte[]> encoder)
      Registers a global response body encoder.
      ServerConfig encoder​(java.lang.String contentType, java.lang.Class objectType, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,​byte[]> encoder)
      Registers a global response body encoder.
      default ServerConfig expectations​(groovy.lang.Closure closure)
      Used to configure HTTP expectations on the server; the provided Groovy Closure will delegate to an Expectations instance for configuring server interaction expectations using the Groovy DSL.
      ServerConfig expectations​(java.util.function.Consumer<Expectations> expects)
      Used to configure HTTP expectations on the server; the provided Consumer<Expectations> implementation will have an active Expectations object passed into it for configuring server interaction expectations.
      Expectations expects()
      An alternate means of starting the expectation chain.
      ServerConfig httpPort​(int value)
      Allows the specific configuration of the HTTP server port.
      ServerConfig https()
      Used to enabled HTTPS on the server.
      ServerConfig https​(boolean enabled)
      Used to control the enabled/disabled state of HTTPS on the server.
      ServerConfig httpsPort​(int value)
      Allows the specific configuration of the HTTPS server port.
      ServerConfig keystore​(java.net.URL location)
      Allows configuration of an external HTTPS keystore with the given location (using the default password "ersatz").
      ServerConfig keystore​(java.net.URL location, java.lang.String password)
      Allows configuration of an external HTTPS keystore with the given location and password.
      ServerConfig reportToConsole()
      Causes the mismatched request reports to be generated as console output, rather than only in the logging.
      ServerConfig reportToConsole​(boolean toConsole)
      Used to toggle the console output of mismatched request reports.
      ServerConfig timeout​(int value)
      Used to specify the server request timeout property value on the server, in seconds.
      ServerConfig timeout​(int value, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit units)
      Used to specify the server request timeout property value on the server.

    • Method Detail

      • https

        ServerConfig https​(boolean enabled)
        Used to control the enabled/disabled state of HTTPS on the server. By default HTTPS is disabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - whether or not HTTPS support is enabled
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • https

        ServerConfig https()
        Used to enabled HTTPS on the server. By default HTTPS is disabled.
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • autoStart

        ServerConfig autoStart​(boolean enabled)
        Used to enable/disable the auto-start feature, which will start the server after any call to either of the expectations configuration methods. With this setting enabled, any other calls to the start() method are ignored. Further configuration is allowed.

        Auto-start is enabled by default.

        Parameters:
        enabled - whether or not auto-start is enabled
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • timeout

        ServerConfig timeout​(int value,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit units)
        Used to specify the server request timeout property value on the server.
        Parameters:
        value - the timeout value
        units - the units the timeout is specified with
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • timeout

        ServerConfig timeout​(int value)
        Used to specify the server request timeout property value on the server, in seconds.
        Parameters:
        value - the timeout value
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • reportToConsole

        ServerConfig reportToConsole()
        Causes the mismatched request reports to be generated as console output, rather than only in the logging.
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • reportToConsole

        ServerConfig reportToConsole​(boolean toConsole)
        Used to toggle the console output of mismatched request reports. By default they are only rendered in the logging. A value of true will cause the report to be output on the console as well.
        Parameters:
        toConsole - whether or not the report should also be written to the console
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • keystore

        ServerConfig keystore​(java.net.URL location,
                      java.lang.String password)
        Allows configuration of an external HTTPS keystore with the given location and password. By default, if this is not specified an internally provided keystore will be used for HTTPS certification. See the User Guide for details about configuring your own keystore.
        Parameters:
        location - the URL of the keystore file
        password - the keystore file password
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • keystore

        ServerConfig keystore​(java.net.URL location)
        Allows configuration of an external HTTPS keystore with the given location (using the default password "ersatz"). By default, if this is not specified an internally provided keystore will be used for HTTPS certification. See the User Guide for details about configuring your own keystore.
        Parameters:
        location - the URL of the keystore file
        Returns:
        a reference to the server being configured

      • expectations

        ServerConfig expectations​(java.util.function.Consumer<Expectations> expects)
        Used to configure HTTP expectations on the server; the provided Consumer<Expectations> implementation will have an active Expectations object passed into it for configuring server interaction expectations. If auto-start is enabled (default) the server will be started after the expectations are applied.
        Parameters:
        expects - the Consumer<Expectations> instance to perform the configuration
        Returns:
        a reference to this server

      • expectations

        default ServerConfig expectations​(@DelegatesTo(value=Expectations.class,strategy=1)
                                  groovy.lang.Closure closure)
        Used to configure HTTP expectations on the server; the provided Groovy Closure will delegate to an Expectations instance for configuring server interaction expectations using the Groovy DSL. If auto-start is enabled (default) the server will be started after the expectations are applied.
        Parameters:
        closure - the Groovy Closure which will provide expectation configuration via DSL
        Returns:
        a reference to this server

      • expects

        Expectations expects()
        An alternate means of starting the expectation chain.
        Returns:
        the reference to the Expectation configuration object

      • decoder

        ServerConfig decoder​(java.lang.String contentType,
                     java.util.function.BiFunction<byte[],​DecodingContext,​java.lang.Object> decoder)
        Configures the given request content decoder for the specified request content-type. The decoder will be configured globally and used if no overriding decoder is provided during expectation configuration.
        Parameters:
        contentType - the request content-type
        decoder - the request content decoder
        Returns:
        the reference to the server configuration

      • decoder

        ServerConfig decoder​(ContentType contentType,
                     java.util.function.BiFunction<byte[],​DecodingContext,​java.lang.Object> decoder)
        Configures the given request content decoder for the specified request content-type. The decoder will be configured globally and used if no overriding decoder is provided during expectation configuration.
        Parameters:
        contentType - the request content-type
        decoder - the request content decoder
        Returns:
        the reference to the server configuration

      • encoder

        ServerConfig encoder​(java.lang.String contentType,
                     java.lang.Class objectType,
                     java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,​byte[]> encoder)
        Registers a global response body encoder.

        param contentType the response content-type to be encoded

        Parameters:
        contentType - the response content type to be encoded
        objectType - the response object type to be encoded
        encoder - the encoder function
        Returns:
        a reference to this server configuration

                             java.lang.Class objectType,
                             java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,​byte[]> encoder)
        Registers a global response body encoder.

        param contentType the response content-type to be encoded

        Parameters:

        encoder - the encoder function

      • authentication

        ServerConfig authentication​(@DelegatesTo(value=AuthenticationConfig.class,strategy=1)
                            groovy.lang.Closure closure)
        Registers authentication configuration as a Groovy Closure.
        Parameters:
        closure - the configuration closure
        Returns:
        a reference to this server configuration

      • authentication

        ServerConfig authentication​(java.util.function.Consumer<AuthenticationConfig> config)
        Registers authentication configuration as a Consumer<AuthenticationConfig>.
        Parameters:
        config - the configuration Consumer
        Returns:
        a reference to this server configuration

      • httpPort

        ServerConfig httpPort​(int value)
        Allows the specific configuration of the HTTP server port. The default ephemeral port should be used in most cases since specifying the port will negate the ability to run tests in parallel and will also allow possible collisions with other running servers on the host.

        Do NOT specify this setting unless you really need to.

        Parameters:
        value - the desired HTTP port
        Returns:
        a reference to this server configuration

      • httpsPort

        ServerConfig httpsPort​(int value)
        Allows the specific configuration of the HTTPS server port. The default ephemeral port should be used in most cases since specifying the port will negate the ability to run tests in parallel and will also allow possible collisions with other running servers on the host.

        Do NOT specify this setting unless you really need to.

        Parameters:
        value - the desired HTTPS port
        Returns:
        a reference to this server configuration
